content.webTitle: No rest for the workers: how the US is out of step on paid leave

fields.headline: No rest for the workers: how the US is out of step on paid leave
fields.bodyText: Of the 21 wealthiest countries, the US is the only one not to guarantee workers paid leave, according to a recent report by the Center for Economic and Policy Research which dubbed it “no vacation nation”. The lack of a federal policy on the issue particularly affects part-time workers, only 40% of whom receive paid vacation. Overall, close to one in four Americans have no paid vacation whatsoever. The report looked at 21 countries that it described as “advanced economies” and found that the US was the only one to have zero days of mandatory paid leave.
